question: How to make sajda?
answer:
QUESTION
Which verses from Quaran and how to make sajda?
ANSWER


Share:
There are 14 places of Sajda in the noble Qur'aan: 1) End of Surah A'raaf%0D%0A(Surah 7 Aayat 206), 2) Surah Ra'ad 13, Aayat 15, 3) Surah Nahl 16, Aayat%0D%0A50, 4) Surah Banu Israaeel 17 Aayat 109, 5) Surah Maryam 19 Aayat 58, 6)%0D%0AFirst one of Surah Hajj (22) for Hanafis and at 2 places for Shaaf'ee at%0D%0AAayat 17, 7) Surah Furqan 25 Aayat 60, 8) Surah Naml 27 Aayat 26, 9) Surah%0D%0AAlif Laam Meem Tanzeel 32 Aayat 15, 10) Surah Sawd 38 Aayat 25, 11) Surah%0D%0AHaameem Sajda 41 Aayat 38, 12) Surah Najm 53 Aayat 62, 13) Surah Inshaqqat%0D%0A84 Aayat25, 14) Surah Alaq 96 Aayat 19%0D%0A%0D%0AThe conditions pertaining to Salaat, Wudhu, time, etc. also pertain to Sajda%0D%0ATilaawat. Sajda is prohibited whilst the sun is rising; precisely at noon%0D%0Aand from the time the colour of the sun changes before sunset until the sun%0D%0Ahas fully set.%0D%0A%0D%0AThe Hanafi method: It is Mustahabb (desirable) to stand up and say, 'Allaahu%0D%0AAkbar' without raising the hands, then go straight down into Sajdah and%0D%0Awhilst standing up say, 'Allaahu Akbar'. There is no Tasleem (Salaam) after%0D%0Astanding up. Although it is better to begin and end this Sajdah from a%0D%0Astanding position, it is also correct to commence and terminate it from a%0D%0Asitting (Jalsa) position.%0D%0A%0D%0ASajda is made by placing the two hands on the ground in line of the ears and%0D%0Aplacing the face between the hands. Sajda should be made on the forehead and%0D%0Anose. The underarm should be exposed by having the arms spread out. The%0D%0Athigh and stomach should also be separated from each other. The toes should%0D%0Abe made facing towards the Qibla and 'Subhaana Rabbiyal A'alaa' should be%0D%0Arecited thrice.%0D%0A%0D%0AThe procedure for women is different in that she should be more concealed by%0D%0Akeeping the thigh and stomach together.%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0AMufti Ebrahim Desai
